trans-unit.source: Symlink—Directories for shared and temporary files are removed from the checkout (log, tmp/pids, and public/system by default). After this step, any needed directories (tmp, public, and config by default) are created if they don’t already exist. This step is completed by symlinking shared directories into the current release, public/system, tmp/pids, and log directories, and then symlinking the release directory to current.
trans-unit.target: 符号链接 -共享文件和临时文件的目录已从签出中删除（默认情况下为 log ， tmp/pids 和 public/system ）。完成此步骤后，将创建所有所需的目录（默认情况下为 tmp ， public 和 config ）。通过将共享目录符号链接到当前 release ， public/system ， tmp/pids 和 log 目录，然后将 release 目录符号链接到 current ，可以完成此步骤。

trans-unit.source: A “chef-client run” is the term used to describe a series of steps that are taken by the chef-client when it is configuring a node. The following diagram shows the various stages that occur during the chef-client run, and then the list below the diagram describes in greater detail each of those stages.
trans-unit.target: “厨师客户端运行”是一个术语，用于描述厨师客户端在配置节点时采取的一系列步骤。下图显示了在chef-client运行期间发生的各个阶段，然后，该图下面的列表更详细地描述了每个阶段。

trans-unit.source: A node_name is different from the one used during the initial chef-client run. This can happen for a number of reasons. For example, if the client.rb file does not specify the correct node name and the host name has recently changed. This issue can be resolved by explicitly setting the node name in the client.rb file or by using the -N option for the chef-client executable.
trans-unit.target: 一个 node_name 与最初的Chef-client运行期间使用的node_name不同。发生这种情况可能有多种原因。例如，如果client.rb文件未指定正确的节点名称，并且主机名最近已更改。通过在client.rb文件中显式设置节点名称或对Chef-Client可执行文件使用 -N 选项，可以解决此问题。

trans-unit.source: A split-brain event is a concept of clustered computing systems in which the cluster loses its heartbeat communication channel and becomes two unconnected pieces. Recovery from a split-brain event can be a complex issue and different clustering software packages use different methods.
trans-unit.target: 甲 split-brain 事件是集群计算系统的概念，其中所述簇失去其心跳通信信道和成为两个未连接件。从 split-brain 事件中恢复可能是一个复杂的问题，并且不同的群集软件包使用不同的方法。

trans-unit.source: A Microsoft Windows registry key can be used as a string in Ruby code, such as when a registry key is used as the name of a recipe. In Ruby, when a registry key is enclosed in a double-quoted string (" "), the same backslash character (\) that is used to define the registry key path separator is also used in Ruby to define an escape character. Therefore, the registry key path separators must be escaped when they are enclosed in a double-quoted string. For example, the following registry key:
trans-unit.target: 可以将Microsoft Windows注册表项用作Ruby代码中的字符串，例如，将注册表项用作配方名称时。在Ruby中，当注册表项包含在双引号字符串（ " " ）中时，用于定义注册表项路径分隔符的反斜杠字符（ \ ）也用于Ruby中，以定义转义字符。因此，当注册表项路径分隔符包含在双引号引起来的字符串中时，必须对其进行转义。例如，以下注册表项：

trans-unit.source: A client is an actor that has permission to access the Chef server. A client is most often a node (on which the chef-client runs), but is also a workstation (on which knife runs), or some other machine that is configured to use the Chef server API. Each request to the Chef server that is made by a client uses a private key for authentication that must be authorized by the public key on the Chef server.

trans-unit.source: A control is an automated test that is built into a cookbook, and then used to test the state of the system for compliance. Compliance can be many things. For example, ensuring that file and directory management meets specific internal IT policies—”Does the file exist?”, “Do the correct users or groups have access to this directory?”. Compliance may also be complex, such as helping to ensure goals defined by large-scale compliance frameworks such as PCI, HIPAA, and Sarbanes-Oxley can be met.
trans-unit.target: 控件是内置于食谱中的自动化测试，然后用于测试系统状态的符合性。合规性可以是很多事情。例如，确保文件和目录管理符合特定的内部IT策略-“文件是否存在？”，“正确的用户或组可以访问此目录吗？”。法规遵从性也可能很复杂，例如有助于确保实现由大规模法规遵从性框架（如PCI，HIPAA和Sarbanes-Oxley）定义的目标。

trans-unit.source: A cookbook can contain the following types of files:

trans-unit.source: A cookbook conflicts with another cookbook or cookbook version. Use a version constraint to define constraints for cookbook versions: < (less than), <= (less than or equal to), = (equal to), >= (greater than or equal to), ~> (approximately greater than), or > (greater than). This field requires that a cookbook with a matching name and version does not exist on the Chef server. When the match exists, the Chef server ensures that any conflicted cookbooks are not included with the set of cookbooks that are sent to the node when the chef-client runs. For example:
trans-unit.target: 食谱与另一个食谱或食谱版本冲突。使用版本约束来定义菜谱版本的约束： < （小于）， <= （小于或等于）， = （等于）， >= （大于或等于）， ~> （大约大于）或 > （大于）。此字段要求Chef服务器上不存在具有匹配名称和版本的食谱。当存在匹配项时，Chef服务器确保在厨师客户端运行时发送到节点的食谱集中不包含任何冲突的食谱。例如：

trans-unit.source: A cookbook is frequently designed to work across many platforms and is often required to distribute a specific file to a specific platform. A cookbook can be designed to support the distribution of files across platforms, while ensuring that the correct file ends up on each system.
trans-unit.target: 一个cookbook经常被设计成可以在许多平台上工作,并且经常需要将一个特定的文件分发到特定的平台上。可以设计一本食谱来支持跨平台分发文件,同时确保正确的文件最终出现在每个系统上。

trans-unit.source: A cookbook is frequently designed to work across many platforms and is often required to distribute a specific template to a specific platform. A cookbook can be designed to support the distribution of templates across platforms, while ensuring that the correct template ends up on each system.
trans-unit.target: 一个cookbook经常被设计成可以在许多平台上使用,并且经常需要将一个特定的模板分发到特定的平台上。可以设计一本食谱来支持跨平台分发模板,同时确保正确的模板最终出现在每个系统上。

trans-unit.source: A cookbook is the fundamental unit of configuration and policy distribution. A cookbook defines a scenario and contains everything that is required to support that scenario:
trans-unit.target: 菜谱是配置和策略分发的基本单位。一本菜谱定义了一个场景,并包含了支持该场景所需的一切。

trans-unit.source: A cookbook library module
trans-unit.target: 烹饪书库模块

trans-unit.source: A cookbook template is an Embedded Ruby (ERB) template that is used to dynamically generate static text files. Templates may contain Ruby expressions and statements, and are a great way to manage configuration files. Use the template resource to add cookbook templates to recipes; place the corresponding Embedded Ruby (ERB) template file in a cookbook’s /templates directory.
trans-unit.target: 食谱模板是嵌入式Ruby（ERB）模板，用于动态生成静态文本文件。模板可能包含Ruby表达式和语句，是管理配置文件的好方法。使用模板资源将食谱模板添加到配方中；将相应的嵌入式Ruby（ERB）模板文件放置在食谱的 /templates 目录中。

trans-unit.source: A cookbook version always takes the form x.y.z, where x, y, and z are decimal numbers that are used to represent major (x), minor (y), and patch (z) versions. A two-part version (x.y) is also allowed. Alphanumeric version numbers (1.2.a3) and version numbers with more than three parts (1.2.3.4) are not allowed.
trans-unit.target: 烹饪书版本总是采用x.y.z的形式,其中x、y和z是十进制数,用于表示主要(x)、次要(y)和补丁(z)版本。也允许使用两部分版本(x.y)。不允许使用字母数字版本号(1.2.a3)和三部分以上的版本号(1.2.3.4)。

trans-unit.source: A cookbook version can be frozen, which will prevent updates from being made to that version of a cookbook. (A user can always upload a new version of a cookbook.) Using cookbook versions that are frozen within environments is a reliable way to keep a production environment safe from accidental updates while testing changes that are made to a development infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: 可以冻结cookbook版本,这将防止对cookbook的该版本进行更新。(用户可以随时上传cookbook的新版本。)使用在环境中冻结cookbook版本的可靠方法,可以保证生产环境在测试对开发基础架构所做的更改时不会发生意外更新。(用户可以随时上传新版本的cookbook。)在环境中使用被冻结的cookbook版本是一种可靠的方法,可以在测试对开发基础架构所做的更改时保持生产环境的安全,防止意外更新。

trans-unit.source: A cookbook version is maintained just like a cookbook, with regard to source control, uploading it to the Chef server, and how the chef-client applies that cookbook when configuring nodes.
trans-unit.target: 一个cookbook版本的维护就像一个cookbook一样,关于源码控制,上传到Chef服务器,以及chef-client在配置节点时如何应用该cookbook。

trans-unit.source: A cookbook version represents a set of functionality that is different from the cookbook on which it is based. A version may exist for many reasons, such as ensuring the correct use of a third-party component, updating a bug fix, or adding an improvement. A cookbook version is defined using syntax and operators, may be associated with environments, cookbook metadata, and/or run-lists, and may be frozen (to prevent unwanted updates from being made).
trans-unit.target: 菜谱版本代表了一套不同于它所基于的菜谱的功能。一个版本的存在可能有很多原因,例如确保正确使用第三方组件、更新错误修复或添加改进。烹饪书版本是使用语法和运算符定义的,可以与环境、烹饪书元数据和/或运行列表相关联,也可以被冻结(以防止进行不需要的更新)。

trans-unit.source: A data bag is a container of related data bag items, where each individual data bag item is a JSON file. knife can load a data bag item by specifying the name of the data bag to which the item belongs and then the filename of the data bag item. The only structural requirement of a data bag item is that it must have an id:

trans-unit.source: A data bag is a global variable that is stored as JSON data and is accessible from a Chef server. A data bag is indexed for searching and can be loaded by a recipe or accessed during a search.

trans-unit.source: A data bag is a global variable that is stored as JSON data and is accessible from a Chef server. The name of the search index is the name of the data bag. For example, if the name of the data bag was “admins” then a corresponding search query might look something like search(:admins, "*:*").
trans-unit.target: 数据包是存储为JSON数据的全局变量，可从Chef服务器访问。搜索索引的名称是数据包的名称。例如，如果数据包的名称为“ admins”，则相应的搜索查询可能类似于 search(:admins, "*:*") 。

trans-unit.source: A data bag item may be encrypted using shared secret encryption. This allows each data bag item to store confidential information (such as a database password) or to be managed in a source control system (without plain-text data appearing in revision history). Each data bag item may be encrypted individually; if a data bag contains multiple encrypted data bag items, these data bag items are not required to share the same encryption keys.
trans-unit.target: 可以使用共享机密加密来加密数据包项目。这允许每个数据袋项目存储机密信息（例如数据库密码）或在源控制系统中进行管理（修订历史记录中不显示纯文本数据）。每个数据袋物品都可以单独加密。如果一个数据袋包含多个加密的数据袋项目，则不需要这些数据袋项目共享相同的加密密钥。

trans-unit.source: A definition behaves like a compile-time macro that is reusable across recipes. A definition is typically created by wrapping arbitrary code around resources that are declared as if they were in a recipe. A definition is then used in one (or more) actual recipes as if the definition were a resource.

trans-unit.source: A definition is code that is reused across recipes, similar to a compile-time macro. A definition is created using arbitrary code wrapped around built-in chef-client resources—file, execute, template, and so on—by declaring those resources into the definition as if they were declared in a recipe. A definition is then used in one (or more) recipes as if it were a resource.

trans-unit.source: A guard property can be used to evaluate the state of a node during the execution phase of the chef-client run. A guard property accepts either a string value or a Ruby block value:
trans-unit.target: 在chef-client运行的执行阶段,guard属性可以用来评估节点的状态。基于这个评估的结果,guard 属性被用来告诉 chef-client 是否应该继续执行资源。guard属性可以接受一个字符串值或Ruby块值。

trans-unit.source: A guard property is useful for ensuring that a resource is idempotent by allowing that resource to test for the desired state as it is being executed, and then if the desired state is present, for the chef-client to do nothing.
trans-unit.target: guard属性对于确保一个资源是幂等的很有用,它允许该资源在执行时测试所需的状态,然后如果所需的状态存在,则厨师客户端什么也不做。

trans-unit.source: A knife plugin is a set of one (or more) subcommands that can be added to knife to support additional functionality that is not built-in to the base set of knife subcommands. Many of the knife plugins are built by members of the Chef community and several of them are built and maintained by Chef. A knife plugin is installed to the ~/.chef/plugins/knife/ directory, from where it can be run just like any other knife subcommand.
trans-unit.target: 刀具插件是一个（或多个）子命令集，可以将其添加到刀中，以支持基本功能而不是基本的刀子命令集内置的其他功能。许多刀插件是由Chef社区的成员构建的，其中一些是由Chef构建和维护的。刀子插件安装在 ~/.chef/plugins/knife/ 目录中，与其他任何刀子命令一样，可以从此处运行。

trans-unit.source: A library allows arbitrary Ruby code to be included in a cookbook, either as a way of extending the classes that are built-in to the chef-client—Chef::Recipe, for example—or for implementing entirely new functionality, similar to a mixin in Ruby. A library file is a Ruby file that is located within a cookbook’s /libraries directory. Because a library is built using Ruby, anything that can be done with Ruby can be done in a library file.
trans-unit.target: 库允许将任意Ruby代码包含在食谱中，既可以作为扩展内置于 Chef::Recipe 客户端（例如Chef :: Recipe）中的类的方式，也可以用于实现全新的功能，类似于Ruby中的mixin。库文件是位于食谱的 /libraries 目录中的Ruby文件。由于库是使用Ruby构建的，因此可以在库文件中完成Ruby可以完成的所有操作。

trans-unit.source: A library allows the use of arbitrary Ruby code in a cookbook, either as a way to extend the chef-client language or to implement a new class.
trans-unit.target: 一个库允许在烹饪书中使用任意Ruby代码,可以作为扩展厨师客户端语言的方式,也可以实现一个新的类。

trans-unit.source: A list of all resources that are included in the resource_collection property for the current chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: 当前厨师客户端运行的 resource_collection 属性中包含的所有资源的列表。

trans-unit.source: A list of defined custom properties (property values are specified in recipes)

trans-unit.source: A list of exception handlers that are available to the chef-client during a chef-client run.

trans-unit.source: A list of properties that controls how the chef-client is to attempt to manage a service: :restart, :reload, :status. For :restart, the init script or other service provider can use a restart command; if :restart is not specified, the chef-client attempts to stop and then start a service. For :reload, the init script or other service provider can use a reload command. For :status, the init script or other service provider can use a status command to determine if the service is running; if :status is not specified, the chef-client attempts to match the service_name against the process table as a regular expression, unless a pattern is specified as a parameter property. Default value: { :restart => false, :reload => false, :status => false } for all platforms (except for the Red Hat platform family, which defaults to { :restart => false, :reload => false, :status => true }.)
trans-unit.target: 控制厨师客户端如何尝试管理服务的属性列表 :restart ， :reload 和 :status 。对于 :restart ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供商可以使用重新启动命令；如果未指定 :restart ，则厨师客户端尝试停止然后再启动服务。对于 :reload ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供者可以使用reload命令。对于 :status ，初始化脚本或其他服务提供者可以使用状态命令来确定服务是否正在运行；如果未指定 :status ，则厨师客户端尝试匹配 service_name 除非将模式指定为参数属性，否则不要将过程表作为正则表达式。所有平台的默认值： { :restart => false, :reload => false, :status => false } （Red Hat平台系列除外，其默认值为 { :restart => false, :reload => false, :status => true } 。）

trans-unit.source: A list of recipes associated with a node (and part of that node’s run-list).
trans-unit.target: 与节点关联的配方列表（以及该节点的运行列表的一部分）。

trans-unit.source: A longer description that ideally contains full instructions on the proper use of a cookbook, including definitions, libraries, dependencies, and so on. There are two ways to use this field: with the contents embedded in the field itself or with the contents pulled from a file at a specified path, such as a README.rdoc located at the top of a cookbook directory.
trans-unit.target: 一个较长的描述,最好包含关于正确使用cookbook的完整说明,包括定义、库、依赖关系等。使用这个字段有两种方法:将内容嵌入字段本身,或者从指定路径的文件中提取内容,比如位于cookbook目录顶部的README.rdoc。

trans-unit.source: A loop statement is used to execute a block of code one (or more) times. A loop statement is created when .each is added to an expression that defines an array or a hash. An array is an integer-indexed collection of objects. Each element in an array can be associated with and referred to by an index.
trans-unit.target: 循环语句用于一次（或多次）执行代码块。将 .each 添加到定义数组或哈希的表达式时，将创建循环语句。数组是对象的整数索引集合。数组中的每个元素都可以与索引关联并由索引引用。

trans-unit.source: A metadata file is used to ensure that each cookbook is correctly deployed to each node.

trans-unit.source: A metadata.json file can be edited directly, should temporary changes be required. Any subsequent upload or action that generates metadata will cause the existing metadata.json file to be overwritten with the newly generated metadata. Therefore, any permanent changes to cookbook metadata should be done in the metadata.rb file, and then re-uploaded to the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: 元数据.json文件可以直接编辑,如果需要临时更改。任何后续的上传或生成元数据的操作都会导致现有的metadata.json文件被新生成的元数据覆盖。因此,任何对食谱元数据的永久性更改都应该在metadata.rb文件中进行,然后重新上传到Chef服务器。

trans-unit.source: A nested field appears deeper in the JSON data structure. For example, information about a network interface might be several layers deep: node[:network][:interfaces][:en1]. When nested fields are present in a JSON structure, the chef-client will extract those nested fields to the top-level, flattening them into compound fields that support wildcard search patterns.
trans-unit.target: 嵌套字段在JSON数据结构中显示得更深。例如，有关网络接口的信息可能要深入几层： node[:network][:interfaces][:en1] 。当JSON结构中存在嵌套字段时，chef-client会将这些嵌套字段提取到顶层，将它们压平为支持通配符搜索模式的复合字段。

trans-unit.source: A partial search query allows a search query to be made against specific attribute keys that are stored on the Chef server. A partial search query can search the same set of objects on the Chef server as a full search query, including specifying an object index and providing a query that can be matched to the relevant index. While a full search query will return an array of objects that match (each object containing a full set of attributes for the node), a partial search query will return only the values for the attributes that match. One primary benefit of using a partial search query is that it requires less memory and network bandwidth while the chef-client processes the search results.
trans-unit.target: 部分搜索查询可以针对存储在Chef服务器上的特定属性键进行搜索查询。部分搜索查询可以在Chef服务器上搜索与完整搜索查询相同的对象集,包括指定一个对象索引,并提供一个可以与相关索引匹配的查询。全搜索查询将返回匹配的对象数组(每个对象都包含节点的完整属性集),而部分搜索查询将只返回匹配的属性值。使用部分搜索查询的一个主要好处是,当厨师客户端处理搜索结果时,它需要较少的内存和网络带宽。

trans-unit.source: A physical node is typically a server or a virtual machine, but it can be any active device attached to a network that is capable of sending, receiving, and forwarding information over a communications channel. In other words, a physical node is any active device attached to a network that can run a chef-client and also allow that chef-client to communicate with a Chef server.
trans-unit.target: 物理节点通常是服务器或虚拟机,但它也可以是连接到网络上的任何活动设备,能够通过通信通道发送、接收和转发信息。换句话说,物理节点是连接到网络上的任何活动设备,它可以运行一个厨师客户端,并允许该厨师客户端与厨师服务器通信。

trans-unit.target: 策略组在已部署的单元中定义了一组主机，这些主机通常映射到组织需求，例如“开发”，“测试”，“分段”和“生产”，但也可以根据需要映射到更详细的需求

trans-unit.source: A quoted 3-5 character string that defines the octal mode. For example: '755', '0755', or 00755. If mode is not specified and if the directory already exists, the existing mode on the directory is used. If mode is not specified, the directory does not exist, and the :create action is specified, the chef-client assumes a mask value of '0777', and then applies the umask for the system on which the directory is to be created to the mask value. For example, if the umask on a system is '022', the chef-client uses the default value of '0755'.
trans-unit.target: 带引号的3-5个字符串，用于定义八进制模式。例如： '755' ， '0755' 或 00755 。如果未指定 mode 且目录已存在，则使用目录上的现有模式。如果未指定 mode ，则目录不存在，并且指定了 :create 操作，chef-client假定掩码值为 '0777' ，然后将要在其上创建目录的系统的umask应用于该 mask 值。例如，如果系统上的umask为 '022' ，则Chef-client使用默认值 '0755' 。

trans-unit.source: A quoted 3-5 character string that defines the octal mode. For example: '755', '0755', or 00755. If mode is not specified and if the file already exists, the existing mode on the file is used. If mode is not specified, the file does not exist, and the :create action is specified, the chef-client assumes a mask value of '0777' and then applies the umask for the system on which the file is to be created to the mask value. For example, if the umask on a system is '022', the chef-client uses the default value of '0755'.
trans-unit.target: 带引号的3-5个字符串，用于定义八进制模式。例如： '755' ， '0755' 或 00755 。如果未指定 mode 且文件已存在，则使用文件上的现有模式。如果未指定 mode ，则文件不存在，并且指定了 :create 动作，则厨师客户端假定掩码值为 '0777' ，然后将要在其上创建文件的系统的umask应用于 mask 值。例如，如果系统上的umask为 '022' ，则Chef-client使用默认值 '0755' 。

trans-unit.source: A random number between zero and splay that is added to interval. Use splay to help balance the load on the Chef server by ensuring that many chef-client runs are not occuring at the same interval. Default value: nil.
trans-unit.target: 介于0和 splay 之间的随机数字，添加到 interval 中。使用splay，通过确保不会在同一时间间隔运行许多Chef-Client，来帮助平衡Chef服务器上的负载。默认值： nil 。

trans-unit.source: A random number between zero and splay that is added to interval. Use splay to help balance the load on the Chef server by ensuring that many chef-client runs are not occuring at the same interval. When the chef-client is run at intervals, --splay and --interval values are applied before the chef-client run.
trans-unit.target: 介于0和 splay 之间的随机数字，添加到 interval 中。使用splay，通过确保不会在同一时间间隔运行许多Chef-Client，来帮助平衡Chef服务器上的负载。当厨师客户机间隔运行时，将在厨师客户机运行之前应用 --splay 和 --interval 值。

trans-unit.source: A random number between zero and splay that is added to interval. Use splay to help balance the load on the Chef server by ensuring that many chef-client runs are not occuring at the same interval. When the chef-client is run at intervals, --splay values are applied first, then the chef-client run occurs, and then --interval values are applied.
trans-unit.target: 介于0和 splay 之间的随机数字，添加到 interval 中。使用splay，通过确保不会在同一时间间隔运行许多Chef-Client，来帮助平衡Chef服务器上的负载。当Chef-Client间隔运行时，将首先应用 --splay 值，然后发生Chef-client运行，然后应用 --interval 值。

trans-unit.source: A resource can also be defined in /libraries directory. Some advantages of this approach include more control over how resources behave in the provider, the ability to control the name of the resource directly, and more options available for writing tests. The resources and providers for a library resource, similar to lightweight resources (defined in the /resources and /providers folders) typically have a separate file for the resource and the provider, but this is not requirement. The main disadvantage of this approach is that resources defined in the /libraries directory may not use the Recipe DSL.
trans-unit.target: 也可以在 /libraries 目录中定义资源。这种方法的一些优点包括：可以更好地控制资源在提供程序中的行为，直接控制资源名称的能力以及更多可用于编写测试的选项。与轻量级资源（在 /resources 和 /providers 文件夹中定义）相似，库资源的资源和提供程序通常为资源和提供程序具有单独的文件，但这不是必需的。这种方法的主要缺点是 /libraries 目录中定义的资源可能不使用Recipe DSL。

trans-unit.source: A role is a way to define certain patterns and processes that exist across nodes in an organization as belonging to a single job function.
trans-unit.target: 角色是一种定义组织中跨节点存在的某些模式和流程属于单一工作职能的方式。

trans-unit.source: A role is a way to define certain patterns and processes that exist across nodes in an organization as belonging to a single job function. Each role consists of zero (or more) attributes and a run-list. Each node can have zero (or more) roles assigned to it. When a role is run against a node, the configuration details of that node are compared against the attributes of the role, and then the contents of that role’s run-list are applied to the node’s configuration details. When a chef-client runs, it merges its own attributes and run-lists with those contained within each assigned role.
trans-unit.target: 角色是一种将组织中各个节点之间存在的某些模式和过程定义为属于单个作业功能的一种方式。每个角色均包含零个（或多个）属性和一个运行列表。每个节点可以分配有零个（或更多）角色。当针对某个节点运行角色时，会将该节点的配置详细信息与角色的属性进行比较，然后将该角色的运行列表的内容应用于该节点的配置详细信息。当厨师客户运行时，它将自己的属性和运行列表与每个分配的角色中包含的属性和运行列表合并。

trans-unit.source: A single loopback interface should be configured using the 127.0.0.1 address. trans-unit.source: A start handler is not loaded into the chef-client run from a recipe, but is instead listed in the client.rb file using the start_handlers attribute. The start handler must be installed on the node and be available to the chef-client prior to the start of the chef-client run. Use the chef-client cookbook to install the start handler.

trans-unit.source: A start handler is used to run events at the beginning of the chef-client run. A start handler can be loaded at the start of a chef-client run by adding the start handler to the start_handlers setting in the client.rb file or by installing the gem that contains the start handler by using the chef_gem resource in a recipe in the chef-client cookbook. (A start handler may not be loaded using the chef_handler resource.)

trans-unit.source: A summary of updates is printed at the end of the chef-client run. A dot (.) is printed for events that do not have meaningful status information, such as loading a file or synchronizing a cookbook. For resources, a dot (.) is printed when the resource is up to date, an S is printed when the resource is skipped by not_if or only_if, and a U is printed when the resource is updated.
trans-unit.target: 在chef-client运行结束时，将打印更新摘要。对于没有有意义的状态信息的事件（例如，加载文件或同步菜谱），将打印点（ . ）。对于资源，当资源为最新时，将打印一个点（ . ），当资源被 not_if 或 only_if 跳过时，将打印一个 S ，而当资源被更新时，一个 U 将被打印。

trans-unit.target: 指定包装类型的符号。可能的值： :custom （如安装嵌入基于的.msi的安装程序非.msi文件） :inno （Inno Setup的） :installshield （InstallShield将） :msi （Microsoft安装程序包（MSI）） :nsis （Nullsoft脚本安装系统（NSIS）），: :wise （明智）。

trans-unit.source: A symbolic link—sometimes referred to as a soft link—is a directory entry that associates a file name with a string that contains an absolute or relative path to a file on any file system. In other words, “a file that contains a path that points to another file.” A symbolic link creates a new file with a new inode that points to the inode location of the original file.
trans-unit.target: 符号链接（有时称为软链接）是目录条目，它将文件名与包含任何文件系统上文件的绝对或相对路径的字符串相关联。换句话说，“一个文件包含指向另一个文件的路径。” 符号链接将创建一个新文件，该文件具有指向原始文件的inode位置的新inode。

trans-unit.source: Actions are policy and administrative changes made to the Chef server. The Chef server gathers a lot of data—–each node object, the node run history for all nodes, the history of every cookbook and cookbook version, how policy settings, such as roles, environments, and data bags, are applied and to what they are applied, individual user data, and so on.
trans-unit.target: 操作是对Chef服务器进行的策略和管理更改。Chef服务器收集大量数据-每个节点对象，所有节点的节点运行历史记录，每个菜谱和菜谱版本的历史记录，如何应用策略设置（例如角色，环境和数据包）以及应用于什么它们被应用，单个用户数据，等等。

trans-unit.source: After the cron job has run successfully, the mount command will show the new logical volume mounted on the /var/opt/opscode/drbd-backups mount point. The backup script will create a snapshot logical volume in unused space in the /opscode volume group. After the snapshot is created, the backup script will attempt to mount the snapshot logical volume, after which the snapshot will stay mounted for 24 hours. Upon the next cron job run, the backup script will attempt to unmount, destroy the snapshot, and then repeat the sequence.
trans-unit.target: 在cron作业成功运行之后， mount 命令将显示在 /var/opt/opscode/drbd-backups 挂载点上挂载的新逻辑卷。备份脚本将在 /opscode 卷组的未使用空间中创建快照逻辑卷。创建快照后，备份脚本将尝试挂载快照逻辑卷，此后快照将保持挂载24小时。在下一个cron作业运行时，备份脚本将尝试卸载，销毁快照，然后重复该顺序。

trans-unit.source: After the initial chef-client run has completed successfully, the chef-validator is no longer required and may be deleted from the node. trans-unit.target: 成功完成初始chef-client运行后，不再需要chef-validator，并且可以从节点中将其删除。使用在 chef-client 食谱（https://github.com/chef-cookbooks/chef-client）中找到的 delete_validation 食谱删除厨师验证器。

trans-unit.source: After the node object is rebuilt, all of the attributes are compared, and then the node is updated based on attribute precedence. trans-unit.source: All attributes in the rebuilt node object are reset. All attributes from attribute files, environments, roles, and Ohai are loaded. Attributes that are defined in attribute files are first loaded according to cookbook order. For each cookbook, attributes in the default.rb file are loaded first, and then additional attribute files (if present) are loaded in lexical sort order. All attributes in the rebuilt node object are updated with the attribute data according to attribute precedence. When all of the attributes are updated, the rebuilt node object is complete.
trans-unit.target: 重建节点对象中的所有属性都将重置。将从属性文件，环境，角色和Ohai中加载所有属性。首先根据食谱顺序加载属性文件中定义的属性。对于每个菜谱，将首先加载 default.rb 文件中的属性，然后按词法排序顺序加载其他属性文件（如果存在）。根据属性优先级，使用属性数据更新重建节点对象中的所有属性。更新所有属性后，重建的节点对象即告完成。

trans-unit.source: All communication with the Chef server must be authenticated using the Chef server API, which is a REST API that allows requests to be made to the Chef server. Only authenticated requests will be authorized. Most of the time, and especially when using knife, the chef-client, or the Chef server web interface, the use of the Chef server API is transparent. In some cases, the use of the Chef server API requires more detail, such as when making the request in Ruby code, with a knife plugin, or when using cURL.
trans-unit.target: 与Chef服务器的所有通信必须使用Chef服务器API进行验证,这是一个REST API,允许向Chef服务器发出请求。只有经过认证的请求才会被授权。大多数时候,特别是在使用 knife、chef-client 或 Chef 服务器 Web 界面时,Chef 服务器 API 的使用是透明的。在某些情况下,Chef服务器API的使用需要更多的细节,比如在Ruby代码中进行请求时,使用刀子插件,或者使用cURL时。

trans-unit.source: All communications are OK.
trans-unit.target: 所有的通讯都正常。

trans-unit.source: All components of computer systems fail, and ethernet networks, while being generally very robust, are no exception. A high availability configuration of the Chef server that uses DRBD depends on a functioning network to begin and maintain replication between the back end servers on which the Chef server is running.
trans-unit.target: 计算机系统的所有组件都会发生故障,以太网网络虽然一般都非常坚固,但也不例外。使用DRBD的Chef服务器的高可用性配置依赖于一个正常运行的网络,以开始并维持Chef服务器运行的后端服务器之间的复制。

trans-unit.source: All syntax examples in this document show variables in ALL_CAPS. For example -u PORT_LIST (where PORT_LIST is a comma-separated list of local and public UDP ports) or -F FORMAT (where FORMAT determines the output format, either summary, text, json, yaml, or pp). These variables often require specific values that are unique to each organization.
trans-unit.target: 本文档中的所有语法示例均显示ALL_CAPS中的变量。例如， -u PORT_LIST （其中PORT_LIST是本地和公共UDP端口的逗号分隔列表）或 -F FORMAT （其中FORMAT确定输出格式， summary ， text ， json ， yaml 或 pp ）。这些变量通常需要每个组织唯一的特定值。

trans-unit.source: An automatic attribute identified by Ohai at the start of the chef-client run
trans-unit.target: 由Ohai在厨师客户运行开始时标识的 automatic 属性

trans-unit.source: An expect(something).to/.to_not be_something is a statement that represents the individual test. In other words, this statement tests if something is expected to be (or not be) something. For example, a test that expects the PostgreSQL pacakge to not be installed would be similar to expect(package('postgresql')).to_not be_installed and a test that ensures a service is enabled would be similar to expect(service('init')).to be_enabled
trans-unit.target: 一 expect(something).to/.to_not be_something 是代表各个测试的声明。换句话说，此语句测试某事物是否应为（或不是）某事物。例如，预期未安装PostgreSQL expect(package('postgresql')).to_not be_installed 的测试将与Expect（package（'postgresql'））。to_not be_installed相似，而确保启用服务的测试将与Expect expect(service('init')).to be_enabled

trans-unit.source: An if statement can be used to specify part of a recipe to be used when certain conditions are met. else and elseif statements can be used to handle situations where either the initial condition is not met or when there are other possible conditions that can be met. Since this behavior is 100% Ruby, do this in a recipe the same way here as anywhere else.
trans-unit.target: 一个 if 语句可用于指定当满足一定条件下使用配方的一部分。 else 和 elseif 语句可用于处理不满足初始条件或满足其他可能条件的情况。由于这种行为是100％的Ruby，因此在这里和其他地方一样，在食谱中执行此操作。

trans-unit.source: An it statement may contain multiple expect statements
trans-unit.target: 一个 it 声明可能包含多个 expect 声明

trans-unit.source: An override attribute is automatically reset at the start of every chef-client run and has a higher attribute precedence than default, force_default, and normal attributes. An override attribute is most often specified in a recipe, but can be specified in an attribute file, for a role, and/or for an environment. A cookbook should be authored so that it uses override attributes only when required.
trans-unit.target: 一个 override 属性会自动重置在每个厨师的客户端开始运行，并具有更高优先级的属性比 default ， force_default ，和 normal 属性。一个 override 属性是最常见的食品中说明，但可以在属性文件中指定，一个角色，和/或环境。应该编写食谱，以便仅在需要时才使用 override 属性。

trans-unit.target: 位于食谱属性文件中的 override 属性

trans-unit.source: An override attribute located in a recipe
trans-unit.target: 位于配方中的 override 属性

trans-unit.source: An override attribute located in a role
trans-unit.target: 位于角色中的 override 属性

trans-unit.source: An override attribute located in an environment
trans-unit.target: 位于环境中的 override 属性

trans-unit.source: An API client is any machine that has permission to use the Chef server API to communicate with the Chef server. An API client is typically a node (on which the chef-client runs) or a workstation (on which knife runs), but can also be any other machine configured to use the Chef server API.
trans-unit.target: API客户端是任何有权限使用Chef服务器API与Chef服务器通信的机器。API客戶端通常是節點(chef客戶端在其上運行)或工作站(刀在其上運行),但也可以是任何其他配置為使用Chef伺服器API的機器。

trans-unit.source: An API request can be made using PyChef, which is a Python library that meets the Mixlib::Authentication requirements so that it can easily interact with the Chef server. The following example shows how an authenticated request can be made using the Chef server API and PyChef:

trans-unit.source: An attribute can be defined in a cookbook (or a recipe) and then used to override the default settings on a node. When a cookbook is loaded during a chef-client run, these attributes are compared to the attributes that are already present on the node. Attributes that are defined in attribute files are first loaded according to cookbook order. For each cookbook, attributes in the default.rb file are loaded first, and then additional attribute files (if present) are loaded in lexical sort order. When the cookbook attributes take precedence over the default attributes, the chef-client will apply those new settings and values during the chef-client run on the node.
trans-unit.target: 可以在食谱（或配方）中定义属性，然后将其用于覆盖节点上的默认设置。在厨师客户端运行期间加载菜谱时，会将这些属性与节点上已经存在的属性进行比较。首先根据食谱顺序加载属性文件中定义的属性。对于每个菜谱，将首先加载 default.rb 文件中的属性，然后按词法排序顺序加载其他属性文件（如果存在）。当Cookbook属性优先于默认属性时，chef-client将在节点上运行cook-client时应用这些新的设置和值。

trans-unit.source: An attribute can be defined in a role and then used to override the default settings on a node. When a role is applied during a chef-client run, these attributes are compared to the attributes that are already present on the node. When the role attributes take precedence over the default attributes, the chef-client will apply those new settings and values during the chef-client run on the node.
trans-unit.target: 属性可以在角色中定义,然后用来覆盖节点上的默认设置。在 chef-client 运行期间应用角色时,这些属性会与节点上已经存在的属性进行比较。当角色属性优先于默认属性时,chef-client将在节点上的chef-client运行期间应用这些新的设置和值。

trans-unit.source: An attribute can be defined in an environment and then used to override the default settings on a node. When an environment is applied during a chef-client run, these attributes are compared to the attributes that are already present on the node. When the environment attributes take precedence over the default attributes, the chef-client will apply those new settings and values during the chef-client run on the node.
trans-unit.target: 属性可以在环境中定义,然后用来覆盖节点上的默认设置。当在厨师客户端运行期间应用环境时,这些属性会与节点上已经存在的属性进行比较。当环境属性优先于默认属性时,chef-client将在节点上的chef-client运行期间应用这些新的设置和值。

trans-unit.source: An attribute is a specific detail about a node, such as an IP address, a host name, a list of loaded kernel modules, the version(s) of available programming languages that are available, and so on. An attribute may be unique to a specific node or it can be identical across every node in the organization. Attributes are most commonly set from a cookbook, by using knife, or are retrieved by Ohai from each node prior to every chef-client run. All attributes are indexed for search on the Chef server. trans-unit.target: 属性是关于节点的具体细节,如IP地址、主机名、加载的内核模块列表、可用的编程语言版本等。一个属性可能对一个特定的节点是唯一的,也可能在组织中的每一个节点中是相同的。属性最常见的是通过使用小刀从食谱中设置,或者在每次厨师客户端运行之前由Ohai从每个节点中检索。所有属性都会被索引,以便在Chef服务器上进行搜索。属性的良好候选者包括。

trans-unit.source: An environment is a way to map an organization’s real-life workflow to what can be configured and managed when using Chef server.

trans-unit.source: An environment is a way to map an organization’s real-life workflow to what can be configured and managed when using Chef server. Every organization begins with a single environment called the _default environment, which cannot be modified (or deleted). Additional environments can be created to reflect each organization’s patterns and workflow. For example, creating production, staging, testing, and development environments. Generally, an environment is also associated with one (or more) cookbook versions.
trans-unit.target: 环境是一种将组织的实际工作流映射到使用Chef服务器时可以配置和管理的工作流的方式。每个组织都以一个称为 _default 环境的环境开头，该环境不能被修改（或删除）。可以创建其他环境以反映每个组织的模式和工作流程。例如，创建 production ， staging ， testing 和 development 环境。通常，环境还与一个（或多个）食谱版本相关联。

trans-unit.source: An exact matching search pattern is used to search for a key with a name that exactly matches a search query. If the name of the key contains spaces, quotes must be used in the search pattern to ensure the search query finds the key. The entire query must also be contained within quotes, so as to prevent it from being interpreted by Ruby or a command shell. The best way to ensure that quotes are used consistently is to quote the entire query using single quotes (‘ ‘) and a search pattern with double quotes (” ”).
trans-unit.target: 完全匹配的搜索模式用于搜索名称与搜索查询完全匹配的键。如果键的名称包含空格，则必须在搜索模式中使用引号，以确保搜索查询找到键。整个查询还必须包含在引号中，以防止Ruby或命令shell解释它。确保引号被一致使用的最佳方法是使用单引号（''）和带双引号（“”）的搜索模式对整个查询进行引号。

trans-unit.source: An exception handler is used to identify situations that have caused a chef-client run to fail. An exception handler can be loaded at the start of a chef-client run by adding a recipe that contains the chef_handler resource to a node’s run-list. An exception handler runs when the failed? property for the run_status object returns true.
trans-unit.target: 异常处理程序用于识别导致厨师客户端运行失败的情况。通过将包含chef_handler资源的配方添加到节点的运行列表，可以在chef-client运行开始时加载异常处理程序。异常处理程序在 failed? 时运行？ run_status 对象的属性返回 true 。

trans-unit.source: An organization is a single instance of a Chef server, including all of the nodes that are managed by that Chef server and each of the workstations that will run knife and access the Chef server using the Chef server API.
trans-unit.target: 一个组织是一个Chef服务器的单一实例,包括由该Chef服务器管理的所有节点,以及每个将运行刀和使用Chef服务器API访问Chef服务器的工作站。

trans-unit.source: An organization is the top-level entity for role-based access control in the Chef server. Each organization contains the default groups (admins, clients, and users, plus billing_admins for the hosted Chef server), at least one user and at least one node (on which the chef-client is installed). The Chef server supports multiple organizations. The Chef server includes a single default organization that is defined during setup. Additional organizations can be created after the initial setup and configuration of the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: 组织是Chef服务器中基于角色的访问控制的顶级实体。每个组织均包含默认组（ admins ， clients 和 users ，以及托管的Chef服务器的 billing_admins ），至少一个用户和至少一个节点（已安装Chef-client的节点）。Chef服务器支持多个组织。Chef服务器包括一个在安装过程中定义的默认组织。在Chef服务器的初始设置和配置之后，可以创建其他组织。

trans-unit.source: An organization isn’t usable until a user that belongs to the admins group is associated with the organization.
trans-unit.target: 除非属于 admins 组的用户与该组织相关联，否则该组织将无法使用。

trans-unit.source: Another example of running the chef-client as a non-root user involves using resources to pass sudo commands as as an attribute on the resource. trans-unit.source: As long as good source code management is practiced with cookbooks and other files in the chef-repo, any missing bits can be re-uploaded after there is a working cluster. In some cases, newly-created users or organizations will need to be re-created. Other actions, such as chef-client runs and uploads may fail while the cluster is in an Inconsistent state, but will be fine after there is a working cluster.
trans-unit.target: 只要在chef-repo中使用食谱和其他文件来实践良好的源代码管理，那么在存在正常工作的集群之后，所有丢失的位都可以重新上传。在某些情况下，将需要重新创建新创建的用户或组织。当群集处于 Inconsistent 状态时，其他操作（例如，chef-client运行和上载）可能会失败，但是在有可用的群集后就可以了。

trans-unit.source: Asynchronous block level replication of logical volume managers, positioned between the two back-end machines
trans-unit.target: 逻辑卷管理器的异步块级复制,定位在两台后端机器之间。

trans-unit.source: At any given time, only one DRBD host has userland access to data, This host is referred to as the primary node. The other host runs the DRBD daemon, but cannot mount the storage into the file system. The secondary node receives information from the primary node, and then replicates disk actions on its local storage copy (even if the partition looks like it doesn’t have a file system to which a mount command can be sent).
trans-unit.target: 在任何给定时间，只有一个DRBD主机可以对数据进行 userland 访问。该主机称为主节点。另一台主机运行DRBD守护程序，但无法将存储装载到文件系统中。辅助节点从主节点接收信息，然后在其本地存储副本上复制磁盘操作（即使分区看起来好像它没有可向其发送 mount 命令的文件系统一样）。

trans-unit.source: At least one action (actions tell the chef-client what to do)
trans-unit.target: 至少有一个动作(动作告诉厨师客户要做什么)。

trans-unit.source: At the beginning of a chef-client run, all attributes are reset. The chef-client rebuilds them using automatic attributes collected by Ohai at the beginning of the chef-client run and then using default and override attributes that are specified in cookbooks or by roles and environments. Normal attributes are never reset. All attributes are then merged and applied to the node according to attribute precedence. At the conclusion of the chef-client run, the attributes that were applied to the node are saved to the Chef server as part of the node object.
trans-unit.target: 在厨师客户端运行开始时,所有属性都被重置。厨师客户端使用Ohai在厨师客户端运行开始时收集的自动属性重建它们,然后使用默认属性和覆盖属性,这些属性是在烹饪书或角色和环境中指定的。普通属性永远不会被重置。然后,所有的属性会被合并,并根据属性优先级应用到节点上。在 chef-client 运行结束时,应用到节点的属性会作为节点对象的一部分保存到 Chef 服务器。

trans-unit.source: At the end of every chef-client run, the node object is saved to the Chef server. From the Chef server, each node object is then added to the SOLR search index. This process is asynchronous. By default, node objects are committed to the search index every 60 seconds or per 1000 node objects, whichever occurs first.
trans-unit.target: 在每次Chef-Client运行结束时，节点对象将保存到Chef服务器。然后，从Chef服务器将每个节点对象添加到 SOLR 搜索索引。此过程是异步的。默认情况下，每60秒或每1000个节点对象将节点对象提交到搜索索引中，以先到者为准。

trans-unit.source: At the end of every chef-client run, the node object is saved to the Chef server. From the Chef server, each node object is then added to the Apache Solr search index. This process is asynchronous. By default, node objects are committed to the search index every 60 seconds or per 1000 node objects, whichever occurs first.
trans-unit.target: 在每次 chef-client 运行结束时,节点对象会被保存到 Chef 服务器上。然后,从Chef服务器上,每个节点对象被添加到Apache Solr搜索索引中。这个过程是异步的。默认情况下,节点对象每 60 秒或每 1000 个节点对象提交到搜索索引中,以先发生的为准。

trans-unit.source: At the end, the recipe is using the notifies property—a common attribute available to all resources—to alert two services (named “foo” and “bar”) that they should restart.
trans-unit.target: 最后，配方使用了 notifies 属性（可用于所有资源的通用属性）来警告两个服务（名为“ foo”和“ bar”）应重新启动。

trans-unit.source: At this point, all users should be able to use their Active Directory or LDAP usernames and passwords to log in to the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: 此时,所有用户应该可以使用他们的活动目录或LDAP用户名和密码登录到Chef服务器。
